nodes.body: A rig stong skor gsas khang, but local people refer to it as Ma ni khang.
nodes.title: 1. Name

nodes.body: The temple is located in a place 118 km northwest of Chab cha, the county town of Gonghe.
nodes.title: 2. Location

nodes.body: sTong skor is known, according to oral tradition, as a large tribe which was originally came from the sTong skor tribe of sTong che valley in Khri ka. They were formerly followers of the Bon religion. However, later almost all of them were converted to Buddhism except seven families who still continue to practise the Bon religion to this day. The temple was founded in 1989 and it was the first one.
nodes.title: 3. History

nodes.body: There are five lay tantrics in the temple.
nodes.title: 5. Current number of practitioners

nodes.body: From the 1st to 5th of the fifth month, the ritual of rNam rgyal stong mchod is performed. In the tenth the ritual cycle of sPyi ’dul is performed. It has no fixed dates.
